appendix.title: Setting up a Netboot Environment for Microsoft* Windows
appendix.para: Setting up &compnode;s running Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2, Microsoft Windows Server 2012, Microsoft &hyper; Server 2012 R2 or Microsoft &hyper; Server 2012 requires to configure the &admserv; to be able to provide the netboot environment for node installation. The environment is generated from a machine running Microsoft Windows Server or Microsoft &hyper; Server.

sect1.title: Requirements
sect1.para: The following requirements must be met to successfully deploy &hyper;:

listitem.para: Provide a separate machine running Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2, Microsoft Windows Server 2012, Microsoft &hyper; Server 2012 R2 or Microsoft &hyper; Server 2012. The machine must be able to access the &admserv; and the Internet.
Install Samba (package samba) and the Microsoft &hyper; tools (package hyper-v) on the &admserv;.

sect1.title: Providing a &hyper; Netboot Environment
sect1.para: To provide a &hyper; netboot environment on the &admserv;, a samba share, that can be mounted on the Windows machine, is created on the &admserv;. Among others, this share contains the &hyper; tools which provide Windows scripts to generate the environment.

step.para: Ensure that the requirements listed at are met.
If you have more than one hard disk, edit /srv/tftpboot/adk-tools/build_winpe.ps1 and adjust the value for $install_media accordingly.
Make sure the Samba daemons smb and nmb are automatically started during boot and are currently running by executing the following commands:
step.screen: systemctl enable smb nmb systemctl start smb nmb

step.para: Edit the Samba configuration file /etc/samba/smb.conf and add the following share:
step.screen: [reminst] comment = MS Windows remote install guest ok = Yes inherit acls = Yes path = /srv/tftpboot read only = No force user = root
step.para: By default, the workgroup name is set to WORKGROUP in the [global] section of /etc/samba/smb.conf. Adjust it, if needed.

sect1.para: Once Samba is properly configured on the &admserv;, log in to the machine running Microsoft Windows Server or Microsoft &hyper; Server and generate the environment:

step.para: Log in to the Microsoft Windows Server or Microsoft &hyper; Server machine. Connect the device name X: to the Samba share \\crowbar\reminst configured on the &admserv; (which is named crowbar by default) in the previous step. This can either be done from the Explorer or on the command line with the net use x: \\crowbar\reminst command.

Device X: contains a directory X:\adk-tools with image creation scripts for either Windows Server 2012 R2 build_winpe_windows-6.3.ps1), Windows Server 2012 (build_winpe_windows-6.2.ps1), &hyper; Server 2012 R2 (build_winpe_hyperv-6.3.ps1) or &hyper; Server 2012 (build_winpe_hyperv-6.2.ps1). sect1.para: After the netboot environment is set up, you can choose either Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012, Hyper-V Server 2012 R2 or Hyper-V Server 2012 as the Target Platform for newly discovered nodes from the Node Dashboard.
